spell.name: Bushcraft: Additional Favored Enemy
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level ranger (HeavyArms)
(This skill can be chosen multiple times)
You gain an additional favored enemy type of your choice.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 5 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Animal Companion
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level ranger (HeavyArms)
You can summon a Beast with a challenge rating of 1/2 or lower from the surrounding area to serve as your animal companion. The summoning ritual takes 1 hour, and can be performed during a short or long rest. The creature accompanies you until you dismiss it, you no longer meet the prerequisites to summon it, you use this feature to summon a different creature, or you die. The following rules apply to your animal companion:
Actions: Your companion is friendly to you and obeys your commands. It loses its Multiattack action, if it has one. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but it only takes evasive actions, unless it is forced to defend itself. If you are incapacitated, your companion can take any action of its choice, though it focuses on protecting you and itself. If the creature has an appropriate anatomy to serve as a mount, it acts under your control while you are riding it.
Game Statistics: Your companion's statistics are altered while it travels with you. It uses your proficiency bonus instead of its own, and adds your proficiency bonus to the AC in its stat block, to a maximum AC of 18. The creature is also considered proficient in all saving throws. Finally, your companion doesn't have Hit Die. Instead, its hit point maximum is calculated as follows:
Companion hit point maximum = (5 + its Constitution modifier) x your ranger level
Resting: At the end of a short rest, your companion regains hit points up to half its hit point maximum. At the end of a long rest, it regains all its lost hit points.
Dropping to 0 Hit Points: If your companion is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, it falls unconscious and makes death saving throws, just like a player character.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 5 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Combat Companion
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd-level ranger (HeavyArms), Animal Companion Skill
You can spend 1 focus point as a bonus action to command your companion to you take one of the actions in its stat block. If you command it to attack, it can make another attack as a bonus action, provided both attacks target the same creature and the target is one of your favored enemies. In addition, your companion gains the following benefits:
• Your companion gains a bonus to its damage rolls equal to your proficiency bonus.
• The initial saving throw DC of your companion's features that force a target to make a saving throw equals 10 + your proficiency bonus if this total is higher than the DC shown in the creature's stat block.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 5 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Ferocious Companion
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level ranger (HeavyArms), Animal Companion Skill
You can summon a Beast with a challenge rating of 2 or lower to serve as your animal companion.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 5 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Monster Ranger
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level ranger (HeavyArms), Animal Companion Skill
You can summon a gelatinous cube or a mimic, instead of a Beast, to serve as your animal companion.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 5 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Arrowsmith
spell.text:
You are considered proficient with all types of artisan's tools for the purpose of crafting special ammunition. In addition, whenever you fail on a craft check to create special ammunition, you create half the number of pieces of ammunition you would have created had you succeeded.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 5 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Combat Drills
spell.text:
(This skill can be chosen multiple times)
You gain a fighting style of your choice from the list of fighting style options available to fighters.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 5 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Double Tough
spell.text:
Whenever you regain hit points during combat, you gain the same number of temporary hit points. These temporary hit points last until the combat ends.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 5 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Eagle Eye Shot
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 9th-level ranger (HeavyArms)
When you make an attack roll with advantage using a ranged weapon and both d20 rolls would hit the target, you can spend 1 focus point to treat both d20 rolls as a 20.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 5 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Field Dressing
spell.text:
As an action, you can expend one use of a healer's kit you are holding to heal yourself or a willing creature within 5 feet of you. The target can immediately spend a number of Hit Dice up to its proficiency bonus, following the normal rules for regaining hit points using Hit Dice. A creature can regain hit points in this way no more than once between rests.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Cleanse
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Field Dressing skill
Whenever you restore hit points to a creature using a healer's kit, it also ends the bleeding, blinded, burning, deafened, and poisoned conditions on the target, and cures any diseases or poisons affecting it.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Free Climb
spell.text:
You can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. Furthermore, while climbing, you can jump as if you had a running start.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Gloom Stalker
spell.text:
While in darkness, you are invisible to any creature that relies on darkvision to see you in that darkness.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Hedge Magic
spell.text:
(This skill can be chosen multiple times)
You learn two cantrips of your choice from the druid spell list. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the druid spell list.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Finder's Magic
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd-level ranger (HeavyArms), Hedge Magic skill
Once between rests, you can cast locate animals or plants or locate object without expending a spell slot.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Overgrowth
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd-level ranger (HeavyArms), Hedge Magic skill
You can spend 1 focus point to cast entangle or spike growth, without expending a spell slot and without material components.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Planar Tether
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 9th-level ranger (HeavyArms), Hedge Magic skill
When a favored enemy you can see within 60 feet of you attempts to travel using teleportation or by extradimensional or interplanar means, you can spend 1 focus point as a reaction to force that creature to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the attempt at travel fails and is wasted
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Shadowbind
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level ranger (HeavyArms), Hedge Magic skill
You can spend 1 focus point as a bonus action to force a creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is bound until the end of its next turn. If the target is a favored enemy, it makes this saving throw with disadvantage.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Trackless Step
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd-level ranger (HeavyArms), Hedge Magic skill
Once between long rests, you can cast pass without trace without expending a spell slot.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Wild Empathy
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Hedge Magic skill
You can cast animal messenger, beast sense, and speak with animals at will, without expending a spell slot.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Hide in Plain Sight
spell.text:
You can Hide when you are lightly obscured, even if you are being directly observed. Furthermore, missing with an attack while hidden doesn't give away your position.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Hide in Plain Sight
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level ranger (HeavyArms)
When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack that deals piercing or slashing damage, you can spend 1 focus point to cause the target to start bleeding (1d6).
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Mutagencraft
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Survived a mutagenic augmentation process
(This skill can be chosen multiple times)
Over the course of a long rest, you can create one mutagenic decoction of your choice. If you have taken this skill more than once, you can instead create a number of mutagenic decoctions of your choice up to the number of times you have taken this skill. Creating decoctions requires access to a set of alchemist's supplies and an empty flask for each one you create. A decoction lasts until it is drunk or until the end of your next long rest, after which time it spoils and is wasted. A creature can drink one of your mutagenic decoctions as an action. The benefits granted by a decoction last until the drinker finishes a short or long rest, unless the decoction's description explicitly says otherwise. Only creatures with the Mutagencraft skill can withstand the harmful side effects of mutagenic decoctions; if a creature without the Mutagencraft skill drinks one of your decoctions, it gains 1 level of exhaustion and becomes poisoned until the decoction's effects end (the decoction's effects end early if the condition is removed).
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Decoctions
spell.text:
The decoctions are presented in alphabetical order.
Arcanis: You gain the ability to cast one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for the spell.
Bat: You transform into a bat. This form lasts until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell).
Blitz: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet. This effect lasts for 1 hour.
Chameleon: Your appearance and your voice change to mimic those of a Small or Medium Humanoid that you have seen before. Your game statistics, other than your size, are the same in each form. Any equipment you are wearing changes to fit your new form. This effect lasts for 1 hour. You can use an action to end it early and revert to your normal form.
Ghostlight: You eyes glow green. You gain the effect of a detect evil and good spell (no concentration required). This effect lasts for 1 hour.
Hryssa: You gain the effects of a jump spell. This effect lasts for 1 hour.
Ironhide: Your skin takes on a dull grey hue. At the start of each of your turns, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus. This effect lasts for 1 hour.
Kulkala: Gills form under your ears and your feet become webbed. You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe underwater.
Lionheart. You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. This effect lasts for 1 hour.
Spegill: You radiate a faint purple aura. You have advantage on saving throws against spells that target you directly, and spell attacks have disadvantage against you. This effect lasts for 1 hour.
Trollblood: Your blood becomes infused with healing magic. At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus, provided you have at least 1 hit point but no more than half of them remaining. This effect lasts for 1 hour.
Witch Sight: Your eyes become like those of a cat or a goat, and assume a color of your choice. You can see in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 6 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Natural Explorer
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level ranger (HeavyArms)
(This skill can be chosen multiple times)
Choose up to two types of favored terrain: arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, swamp, urban, or underground. While traveling in your favored terrain, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws related to your surroundings, and you can't be tracked by nonmagical means, unless you choose to leave a trail.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Blink Step
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Natural Explorer skill
Whenever you take the Dash action while in your favored terrain, you can to teleport a distance up to your speed to an unoccupied space you can see, instead of gaining extra movement for the turn.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Vanish
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Blink Step skill
Whenever you teleport using the Dash action while in your favored terrain, you can turn invisible until the end of your next turn. This invisibility ends early if you attack, cast a spell, or force a creature to make a saving throw.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Pathfinder
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Natural Explorer skill
Creatures traveling with you also gain the benefits of your Natural Explorer skill. Furthermore, difficult terrain doesn't slow your group's travel while traveling in your favored terrain.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Reflex Action
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level ranger (HeavyArms)
You can use your Swift Action feature without spending a focus point.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Scavenger
spell.text:
While traveling in the wilderness, you can spend time scavenging or making useful items. This activity can be performed as part of a long rest or while traveling at a slow pace. At the end of every hour spent, make a Wisdom (Survival) check. You create or find adventuring gear and other valuables (which can include coin) with a total value in gp equal to the check total.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Threat Map
spell.text:
You are aware of the location of any creature within 30 feet of you, provided that the creature isn't hidden from you and you aren't blinded, deafened, or unconscious. Invisible creatures that aren't hidden from you gain no benefit from being invisible against you. This effect can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Magic Sense
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Threat Map skill
You are always under the effect of a detect magic spell.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Wide Scan
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Threat Map skill
The range of your Threat Map feature increases to 60 feet, and creatures within that range can't be hidden from you.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Thrown Weapon Master
spell.text:
Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with thrown weapons.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Trap Expertise
spell.text:
You add your proficiency bonus to the initial save DC of traps you set, and you are considered proficient with a set of thieves' tools for the purpose of disarming traps.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Trap Sense
spell.text:
You have advantage on ability checks you make to detect the presence of traps and dungeon hazards and on saving throws made to avoid or resist them.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Wilderness Expertise
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level ranger (HeavyArms)
(This skill can be chosen multiple times)
Choose two of your ranger skill or tool proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Woodland Stride
spell.text:
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet. If you have a climbing or swimming speed, this increase applies to that speed as well. In addition, moving through nonmagical difficult terrain doesn't cost you any extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bushcraft: Freerunner
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level ranger (HeavyArms), Woodland Stride skill
You are always under the effects of a freedom of movement spell.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger p. 7 (Homebrew)
